skill.name: deep-reading-analyst
skill.description: Comprehensive framework for deep analysis of articles, papers, and long-form content using 10+ thinking models (SCQA, 5W2H, critical thinking, inversion, mental models, first principles, systems thinking, six thinking hats). Use when users want to: (1) deeply understand complex articles/content, (2) analyze arguments and identify logical flaws, (3) extract actionable insights from reading materials, (4) create study notes or learning summaries, (5) compare multiple sources, (6) transform knowledge into practical applications, or (7) apply specific thinking frameworks. Triggered by phrases like 'analyze this article,' 'help me understand,' 'deep dive into,' 'extract insights from,' 'use [framework name],' or when users provide URLs/long-form content for analysis.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate educational skill containing thinking frameworks and analysis templates. No security risks detected - it's purely educational content about critical thinking and analysis methods.

content.user_title: Analyze Articles Deeply with Thinking Frameworks
content.value_statement: Transform passive reading into active learning. This skill guides you through 10+ proven thinking frameworks to extract deeper insights from any article or paper.
actual_capabilities: Apply 10+ thinking frameworks (SCQA, 5W2H, mental models, etc.)
Structure analysis by depth levels (15min to 120min+)
Generate actionable insights from any content
Create learning notes and application plans
limitations: Requires active user engagement - not passive summarization
Analysis depth depends on user's time commitment
Framework selection requires user context about goals
Cannot verify factual accuracy of source content

use_cases.title: Strategic Article Analysis

use_cases.title: Transform Reading into Learning

prompt_templates.title: Quick Article Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this article using SCQA and 5W2H frameworks: [paste article]. Give me the key insights and one action item.

prompt_templates.title: Deep Research Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to deeply understand these 3 papers on [topic]. Use mental models, systems thinking, and first principles to compare them and extract the core truths.

prompt_templates.title: Critical Evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me critically analyze this opinion piece. Use critical thinking and inversion to identify logical flaws and hidden assumptions.

prompt_templates.title: Learning Synthesis
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating study notes from educational content
prompt_templates.prompt: Transform this educational content into structured learning notes. Use the output templates to create actionable knowledge I can apply.

output_examples.input: Analyze this article about remote work using multiple frameworks
output: SCQA Analysis: Situation - Remote work tech matured... Complication - But managers struggle with productivity...
5W2H Check: Missing 'How much' - no cost analysis provided
Mental Models: Using economics (opportunity cost) - commuting time saved worth $X/hour
Inversion Thinking: How to make remote work fail? Skip team building ‚Üí isolation ‚Üí turnover
Key Insight: Success depends on intentional culture-building, not just tools
Action Item: Schedule weekly virtual coffee chats with my remote team

best_practices: Start with user's purpose - ask why they're reading before choosing frameworks
Progress from simple to complex - don't overwhelm with all frameworks at once
Always end with application - connect insights to user's specific context
anti_patterns: Applying every framework to every article - match depth to user's needs
Accepting article claims without critical evaluation - always stress-test arguments
Creating generic summaries - focus on user-specific actionable insights

faq.question: Which framework should I use first?
faq.answer: Start with SCQA for structure, then 5W2H for completeness. Add critical thinking for evaluation. Let the skill suggest based on your content type.

faq.question: How long does deep analysis take?
faq.answer: Quick analysis: 15 minutes (SCQA + 5W2H). Standard: 30 minutes (+ critical thinking). Deep: 60 minutes (+ all frameworks). Research: 120+ minutes (multi-source).

faq.question: Can this analyze non-English content?
faq.answer: Yes, the thinking frameworks work with any language. The skill will analyze the structure and logic regardless of the source language.

faq.question: Is this just for academic papers?
faq.answer: No, it works for any content - blog posts, news articles, reports, even podcasts. The skill adapts frameworks to content type.

faq.question: How is this different from simple summarization?
faq.answer: Summarization compresses content. This skill helps you understand, evaluate, and apply content through structured thinking - turning reading into learning.

faq.question: Can I save my analysis for later?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill provides structured output templates you can copy. Use the learning notes template to create reusable knowledge files.
